name: FFLD
purpose: This function will return the pointer (P or F) for a field. The function can also return a logical value to indicate that the field was not found.

parts.description: The name or number of the field to search for.
What to return. ‘P’ returns a P type pointer, ‘F’ returns an F type pointer, and ‘L’ returns a logical value.

comments: If the return type is P or F, and you use a number and it is out of range, or the field name is not found, the program will return an error. If the return type is L the function will return .F.
